results.title: They are left without posibility return home!
results.content:
They are left without means of transportation to leave the island and return home!  In a few days, hundreds of people in the delta will be without public transport. The shipping company Francisco Buiatti e Hijos S.A. (line 450, “El Jilguero”) wants to stop providing essential services that allow them to access work, education and health care. These people need your help to prevent this!

What are they asking for?
They need to pay the transport company a monthly fee for 2 trips per day:
- At 8 p.m. Departure from the Tigre river terminal.
- The 7-hour tour departs from Paraná and Toledo, passes through Arroyo Espera and ends at 9:30 a.m. at the river terminal.

Many families use these boats to go to work, take children to school and visit hospitals.

results.title: Products for children from Irpen!
results.content:
The war in Ukraine has become a great tragedy and challenge for all of us. We cannot but draw attention to the fact that the events in Ukraine today affect the lives of children and their well-being.

We have now taken 60 families under our care from the Service for Children and Families of Irpin City Council. These are large and low-income families, families in difficult life circumstances, and IDP families. Each family has its own complicated story. We want to help them overcome temporary difficulties and provide our beneficiaries with food packages that will consist of sausages, butter, oil, buckwheat, rice, different types of chicken meat, fresh fruit, sweets and much more. The cost of one food set is UAH 1,500.

We ask everyone who cares to support our project with any amount of money! Make your own contribution to the well-being of families who, together with their children, were forced to flee the war and now need outside support.

Let's make the world a better place together!

results.title: Animals that experience war – help the zoo
results.content:
Last spring, the Kharkiv Zoo opened its doors to visitors for the first time since the beginning of the full-scale invasion.

For the third year in a row, the institution is learning to survive in war conditions and constantly needs support.

Currently, visiting the facility is free, which means that the zoo does not receive any profit and survives at the expense of benefactors.

The Kharkiv Zoo has an important historical value, and is also an object of the Kharkiv Natural Reserve Fund of national importance. This is the first zoo in Ukraine (founded in 1895), and also one of the twenty oldest in the world.

In terms of the value of the collection, the zoo ranks second in Ukraine — after the Kyiv Zoo. More than 384 species of animals are preserved in the zoological park, which is 8 thousand individuals, including fish, amphibians, reptiles, birds, mammals, etc.

Our goal is to provide the zoo with 1,500 kg of meat (approximately 100 kg of meat is needed per day to feed the animals). The zoo itself has the following types of carnivores: bears, wolves, hyenas, lions, lynxes, and tigers.

We have been actively supporting the zoo since the beginning of the full-scale invasion, and as part of the project we have already bought food for the animals for UAH 14,080, but this aid is not enough, the animals need our support.

Thank you for your concern!

results.title: Cherry blossoms in the Vidardny park
results.content:
In city parks and squares, trees play an important role in creating a healthy and comfortable environment for city residents and visitors. They reduce the amount of carbon dioxide in the air and absorb harmful substances, which allows you to reduce the risk of respiratory diseases.

It is planned to create a sakura alley in Vidradny park, which will consist of 8 trees. Sakura trees are one of the most beautiful and symbolic trees in the world. They are known for their unique appearance and floral beauty. Sakura flowers symbolize beauty and youth, and their color can vary from white to deep pink. Sakuras are also known for their very short bloom, which makes this phenomenon even more precious and beautiful.

Sakura Alley in Vidradny Park will create an unparalleled atmosphere for relaxation and walks in the natural environment. It will become a new pearl of the city and will be a decoration for photo sessions and rest with family and friends.

Therefore, we invite everyone to join this important project and support the creation of a cherry blossom alley in Vidradny Park. The collected funds will be used to buy trees. Kyivzelenbud will help with planting and care.

results.title: More than 30 years of waiting
results.content:
The eastern bank of the Quin Manzano River, located in the province of Neuquén, has been waiting for more than 30 years for a bridge to be built that would improve the situation and make it safe for locals to cross the river. Without a bridge or other effective crossing, residents are forced to cross the river to access basic services such as shops, health care and education.

The current situation is not only a huge inconvenience, but also a real threat to the safety of people living in this region. The accident rate when crossing the river is a clear manifestation of this risk. This problem has been going on for three decades, and during this period there have been many improvements in infrastructure at the national and global levels. However, Quin Manzano is still ignored.

results.title: Education for Underprivileged Kids
results.content: Millions of children lack access to basic education. Our goal is to provide learning materials, build small community centers, and support teachers who can help these kids dream beyond their circumstances.

results.title: Planting 10,000 Trees for a Greener Future
results.content: Deforestation is threatening biodiversity and accelerating climate change. Our mission is to plant 10,000 trees in deforested areas, restoring ecosystems and improving air quality. Every donation helps us provide seedlings, tools, and training for volunteers who will carry out this vital work.

results.title: Clean Water for Rural Villages
results.content: Many rural villages lack access to clean drinking water, leading to disease and malnutrition. Our goal is to install sustainable water filtration systems and provide clean water to over 500 families.

results.title: Meals for Homeless Families
results.content: Thousands of homeless individuals struggle to find their next meal. Our program provides nutritious meals and fresh food baskets to families in shelters and on the streets.

results.title: Rescue Shelter for Abandoned Animals
results.content: Each year, thousands of pets are abandoned with nowhere to go. We’re building a safe shelter to provide medical care, rehabilitation, and adoption services for rescued animals.

results.title: Mental Health Support for Youth
results.content: Teen mental health is often overlooked, leading to isolation and depression. We’re creating safe spaces for young people to receive therapy, community support, and coping resources.

results.title: Renewable Energy for Small Villages
results.content: Many villages still rely on unsafe, costly fuel sources. We aim to install solar panels in low-income areas, providing clean, affordable energy to 1,000 homes.

results.title: Transportation for Disabled Individuals
results.content: Many disabled individuals struggle with transportation, limiting their independence. We’re funding accessible vehicles and ride programs to help them move freely.

results.title: Affordable Housing for Low-Income Families
results.content: Housing costs are rising, leaving families homeless. We’re building affordable homes that provide stability, safety, and hope for families struggling financially.

results.title: Hospital Equipment for Remote Clinics
results.content: Remote clinics lack essential medical equipment, making emergency treatment nearly impossible. We’re raising funds to supply ventilators, defibrillators, and critical care machines to hospitals in need.

results.title: DIY Tiny Backyard Greenhouse
results.content: I've always dreamed of growing my own herbs and veggies at home. I need funds to build a small greenhouse with eco-friendly materials.

results.title: Bike for Daily Commute
results.content: I need an affordable bike to replace my expensive commute and reduce my carbon footprint.

results.title: Children's school assistants
results.content:
In the modern world, education plays a key role in the development and formation of personality. Every child has the right to quality education and development. Stationery helps children in the learning process. It plays an important role in the life of schoolchildren, helps them learn, develop and feel comfortable in the learning process, develop creative skills, fine motor skills, coordination of movements and visual perception. Unfortunately, not all children have the necessary materials and tools for learning.

In our Center for Social and Psychological Rehabilitation, children not only receive psychological, social, speech therapy, but also have the opportunity to feel like real children. We create an atmosphere of family, support and care for them. They find new friends, go to additional classes, do homework with social teachers in our Center and of course, like all children, go to school. Therefore, like all schoolchildren, they need high-quality school supplies that will help them in the learning process. Your help will provide children with the necessary stationery, which will positively affect their academic performance and motivation to study.

We need your financial support in order to provide 12 children living in our Center for Social and Psychological Assistance in Kyiv with the necessary stationery (notebooks, pencils, ballpoint pens, colored cardboard, paper, brushes, glue, scissors, etc.) and to pay the salary of a social worker who works with children. Give children the opportunity to receive quality knowledge and develop in comfortable conditions.

results.title: A place for lonely old people.
results.content:
The Second Youth Club for the elderly is a place where lonely elderly people from Kharkiv find attention, care and socializing. The club has been operating for over 24 years, despite a lack of funding or other current challenges. Even since the outbreak of full-scale hostilities in 2022, the club's staff has continued to communicate with and support its beneficiaries. Moreover, taking into account the new needs of its audience, the number of social services at the club is increasing: psychological services, assistance in minor repairs of apartments, etc.

The main reason why the elderly come to the club is to feel a sense of belonging to society and peers, to share their joy or problems, to find solutions, and to help another person. In the club, the elderly do not feel lonely and unwanted. Here, they continue to be individuals with a lot of life experience.

For a long time, the project “A Place of Communication for Lonely Old People” has been self-financed. Despite all the difficulties, our foundation does not plan to close the project, given its great social importance.

For the regular operation of the club, funds are needed every month to rent the premises and pay utility bills, to buy goodies for tea parties, and to pay salaries to project staff. As part of this project, we traditionally raise funds to pay for rent and utilities. Of course, we ask you to join the fundraiser and make a charitable donation to implement important social assistance for the elderly. We sincerely believe that together we can give the elderly a sense of joy and unity. Thank you all for your support!

results.title: Support Darinka!
results.content:
Daryna is the only child in the family who has been fighting for her right to a full life since birth. Her journey has been difficult and full of hardships. Even before her birth, doctors made difficult diagnoses, and at five months old she began to have seizures, after which she lost all the skills she had mastered.

Now Daryna is 2 years old, and she has only recently learned to roll over and sit with the support of her hands. She still has a difficult and long way ahead of her, but we believe she is capable of more. Her diagnoses include brain developmental disorder, symptomatic epilepsy, and delayed psycho-linguistic and statokinetic development.

Daryna needs constant rehabilitation: physical therapy, sensory integration, lessons with a speech therapist, swimming pool, etc. Classes with qualified specialists are already yielding excellent results, improving the girl's physical and emotional state. There is progress, and it is important for her development!

However, all this requires a lot of money, which the family does not have at the moment. Your contribution is a chance for Daryna to be like other children: to play, walk and learn.

Do not be indifferent, help our little heroine to get a chance for a happy childhood! Each of your contributions is an important step towards helping Daryna take her first independent steps, enjoy every day and be healthy.

Please support Daryna! Together we can make her life better!

results.title: Olia is the second sick child in her family
results.content:
Four years ago, when Olia was five years old, she and her parents went to visit her grandmother. It was hot summer weather outside, so they didn't pay the necessary attention to Olia's thirst, which was making her very thirsty. The girl had a good appetite and a good mood, which did not raise suspicions of illness. But a strange thing happened – Olia was too fond of sweets and ate a lot of them. A blood sugar test suggested by the doctor revealed a very high reading. Unfortunately, the fears came true: the girl was diagnosed with insulin-dependent diabetes. And then – as with all children with this diagnosis – resuscitation, drips, tears.

Then the family was in trouble again. Again, because Olia's brother had been suffering from diabetes for several years. The girl became the second sick child of her parents. It was more difficult for her mother with her daughter than with her son. The little girl did not understand her illness, why she could not eat when she wanted and as much as she wanted, why she constantly needed to pierce her fingers to measure glucose levels and inject insulin. But time goes on, children grow up. Olia is already graduating from the third grade. Doctors assured her mother that diabetes is a way of life. But her mother believes that diabetes is a hard day's work that requires attention around the clock. The woman has no medical education, but over the years she has become an endocrinologist for her children.

The parents work hard to provide their children with everything they need. But it is difficult to support one child with diabetes. With two children, it is even more difficult. Unfortunately, it is not always possible to provide Olia with everything she needs, including the means to constantly monitor her sugar levels. That's why her mother is asking for help.

results.title: Charity Book Drive for Kids
results.content: I dream of organizing a book donation drive for children in need. Funds will help purchase books and set up collection points.

results.title: Help please Mateo!
results.content: Mateo is a 9 year old boy with a musculoskeletal disorder... he suffers from hydrocephalus, due to lack of therapy his muscles are atrophying and he is losing strength. Thanks to therapy he has achieved a lot: he can now stand and walk. He MUST continue therapy to improve his quality of life, which he does not have access to due to lack of payment o.s.c.t.c.p.

results.title: Support the girls and boys of Mexico
results.content:
Dreams unite us. Support the girls and boys of Mexico in achieving their dreams... Do you remember what you dreamed of when you were a child?
Maybe you wanted to be an astronaut, an artist, a teacher, an engineer, a doctor, or a lawyer... Behind every dream we achieved, there was someone who supported us. Today, you can be that person for thousands of children in Mexico who need an opportunity.

Today, you can help more children in Mexico and around the world have the chance to dream of a better future.

In Mexico...

1 in 2 children or adolescents suffers from violence.
1 in 8 children under the age of 5 suffers from chronic malnutrition.
8 in 10 indigenous children and adolescents live in poverty.
4 in 10 children ages 0 to 5 live in poverty.

More than 10 million children with severe malnutrition do not receive treatment.

At UNICEF, we are present in Mexico and around the world, providing food, water, education, psychosocial support, and protection to those most in need.

What can you do?
Celebrate the child you once was by supporting today's children. Your donation can result in:

School kits for children to return to school.
Treatment for children with acute malnutrition.
Safe spaces and medical care for migrant children.
Reconstruction of schools affected by disasters.

results.title: Learning Sign Language
results.content: I want to take a sign language course to communicate better with hearing-impaired people and make the world more inclusive.

results.title: Building a Meditation Space
results.content: I want to create a peaceful corner in my home where I can meditate and relax. Funds will go toward soft lighting, cushions, and soundproofing materials.

results.title: Rescuing a Stray Dog
results.content: There’s a stray dog in my neighborhood that needs urgent medical care. The funds will help cover vet bills, vaccinations, and adoption costs.

results.title: Cooking Masterclass Course
results.content: I want to take an online professional cooking course to improve my skills and create delicious meals for my friends and family.

results.title: Home Gym Setup
results.content: I want to build a small home gym to stay active and improve my health. The funds will cover basic equipment like dumbbells, resistance bands, and a yoga mat.

results.title: Adopt a Rescue Kitten
results.content: I've always wanted to adopt a rescue kitten and provide a loving home. The funds will help cover adoption fees, vaccinations, a starter kit with food and supplies, and a cozy bed.

results.title: Painting Kit for Art Therapy
results.content: I've found that painting helps relieve stress and anxiety. I need supplies like brushes, canvases, and paints to continue my therapeutic art practice.

results.title: Community Gardening Project
results.content: I want to start a community gardening project where neighbors can grow their own fresh vegetables together. The funds will help buy seeds and tools.
